definition: senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel

sentences.english: Statue of the Turkmenbashi, President Niyazov.
sentences.chinese: 尊稱爲“土庫曼巴什”的尼亞佐夫總統的雕像。

sentences.english: People respectfully called him the venerable Zhu.
We celebrate Washington today as the greatest of the founding fathers.
sentences.chinese: 今日，我們尊稱華盛頓爲美國國父。

sentences.english: He taught people the way and was titled Suirenshi honorificly.
sentences.chinese: 他把取火的方法教給人民，人民便尊稱他爲燧人氏。

sentences.english: And many churches refer to their leader as Reverend.
sentences.chinese: 而教會提到教會的者，則以牧師尊稱。

sentences.english: Adrian: Satnam. Stop siring me. How deep do we need to go?
sentences.chinese: 別再用尊稱了。我們要下到多深？

sentences.english: Or you may occasionally hear it used in the workplace, where employees want to show respect for their superiors.
sentences.chinese: 或者是在工作的地方，員工對上級的尊稱。

sentences.english: The wolf species is one that has been honored as "teachers" in Native American tradition.
sentences.chinese: 在美洲土著傳統中狼物種被尊稱爲“教師”。

sentences.english: A servant who offers customers tea in teahouses is respectfully called the Tea Service Master.
sentences.chinese: 在茶館中招待顧客的侍者被尊稱爲茶博士。

sentences.english: The inside address of a letter to an individual consists of the person's courtesy title.
sentences.chinese: 如果信是寫給個人的，封內地址包括禮貌尊稱。

sentences.english: Messire term SONG Shi is a high-ranking officials of the honorific, and future generations are becoming devalued.
sentences.chinese: 相公一詞，宋時是對高官的尊稱，後代卻愈來愈貶值。

sentences.english: The ceremony was hailed as the "wedding of the decade."
sentences.chinese: 這場婚禮被尊稱爲“世紀婚禮”。

sentences.english: Because you are called Archmage, do you take me for a village sorcerer?
sentences.chinese: 只因爲你被尊稱爲大法師，就把我當作鄉野術士了？

sentences.english: She was known in her family as ‘the Duchess’.
sentences.chinese: 她在家族裏的尊稱是“公爵夫人”。

sentences.english: Responsible for the steamer with wine technician was honored as two technicians.
sentences.chinese: 負責裝甑的釀酒技師被尊稱爲二技師。

definition: person (first person, second person etc in grammar)/called/known as
called/to call sth (by a name)/to name
founder (of a craft, religious sect etc)
Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot
Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]
great scholar respected for learning and integrity
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
